subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 43
msgSnippet: Not a bad idea at all but it would lead to some pretty long assertions that could be relatively difficult to interpret. Also in my case I am testing pairs (or
messageBody:
Not a bad idea at all but it would lead to some pretty long assertions that could be relatively difficult to interpret.
Also in my case I am testing pairs (or more) of methods so the assertion is kind of testing the second part of the pair.
In the longer term all of the assertions should succeed so having a bunch of assertions one after the other will not be
such a problem.

Scott

> Gerry Wheeler wrote:
> How about writing your test code to use one or more booleans to
> indicate success or failure of your individual tests, and then have a
> single assertion that tests the boolean(s)?
>
> Scott Eade wrote:
> > 1. A single application method invocation often has multiple effects
> > that need several assertions to test - no matter
> > which assertions fail, the same piece of functionality (or chunk of
> > application code) needs to be fixed. I imagine this
> > is a fairly common scenario but that it doesn't normally generate
> > too many assertions.
